Since it's not clear if the abbreviations V OC, J SC, FF, and PCE refer to material properties or not, I'll provide you with a table of the most common material properties for reference. You can then identify which of the properties in the table are mentioned in the paragraph.

| Material Property | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Density | Mass of a substance per unit volume. |
| Young's Modulus | Measure of the stiffness of a material. |
| Poisson's Ratio | Measure of the deformation of a material in a direction perpendicular to the applied load. |
| Thermal Conductivity | Measure of the ability of a material to conduct heat. |
| Electrical Conductivity | Measure of the ability of a material to conduct electricity. |
| Melting Point | Temperature at which a material changes from a solid to a liquid. |
| Boiling Point | Temperature at which a material changes from a liquid to a gas. |
| Specific Heat Capacity | Amount of heat required to raise the temperature of a unit mass of a material by a unit degree. |

Based on the information provided in the paragraph, it's not possible to determine which of the above material properties are being referred to. If you have more context or information, please let me know and I can help you further.
